page.title: 06HOUSING-HORBLING,B'BOROUGH
page.content: The survey showed a variety of housing-home ownership,council housing,private rental.The older houses are built of stone or red brick.Many of the houses are family homes.Housing for the elderly is provided by 1.The Old Hall-a private nursing home.2.Toller Court-sheltered accomodation.3.The Nests administered by the Vicar and two Church wardens. One of the largest houses in the village is Buckminster House.Once owned by the Dean family, it is now a children's home. There are few new houses being built in the area. The Crown owns the majority of the land which is rich farmland and it is reluctant to sell for building purposes.
